qas.question: Which cardinal direction is signified by red in China?
What season is red identified with in China?
Red paper is used to wrap gifts of money during what special celebration in China?
Who wrote the Little Red Book?
In what year was the Little Red Book published?

plausible_answers.text: courage, loyalty, honor, success, fortune, fertility, happiness, passion, and summer

qas.question: What does red signify in southern cultural traditions?
What is hong bao the Cantonese word for?
What is lai see the Mandarin word for?
Who does the Red Little Book quote?

context: In China, red (simplified Chinese: 红; traditional Chinese: 紅; pinyin: hóng) is the symbol of fire and the <a0_0>south<a0_0/> (both south in general and Southern China specifically). It carries a largely positive connotation, being associated with <b5_0>courage, loyalty, honor, success, fortune, fertility, happiness, passion, and <a1_0>summer<b5_0/><a1_0/>. In Chinese cultural traditions, red is associated with weddings (where brides traditionally wear red dresses) and red paper is frequently used to wrap gifts of money or other objects. <b6_0><b7_0>Special red packets<b7_0/><b6_0/> (simplified Chinese: 红包; traditional Chinese: 紅包; pinyin: hóng bāo in Mandarin or lai see in Cantonese) are specifically used during <a2_0>Chinese New Year<a2_0/> celebrations for giving monetary gifts. On the more negative side, obituaries are traditionally written in red ink, and to write someone's name in red signals either cutting them out of one's life, or that they have died. Red is also associated with either the feminine or the masculine (yin and yang respectively), depending on the source. The Little Red Book, a collection of quotations from <a3_0><b9_0>Chairman Mao Tse-Tung<b9_0/><a3_0/>, founding father of the <b8_0>People's Republic of China<b8_0/> (PRC), was published in <a4_0>1966<a4_0/> and widely distributed thereafter.
